id: A Test of Trump: Midterms Could Result in a Mixed Verdict
paragraph: November 17, 2018WASHINGTON—Tuesday’s midterm elections, widely viewed as a referendum on Donald Trump’s presidency, have party strategists preparing for a split decision, with polls indicating Democrats on track to gain a House majority while Republicans keep control of the Senate.Such a result, if it comes to that, would partly be a product of simple geography: The most-expensive midterm election in history is being fought out in two Americas undergoing a political realignment.WSJ MembershipCustomer ServiceTools & FeaturesAdsMore
